constructor.details: Pass the address as a parameter to deployer in migrations along with the contract

initiateFlashLoan(address,uint256).details: Caller must deposit premium before requesting a FlashLoan, they may send it along with this method call

params.amount: Amount of token to request for the loan
params.token: Token address for the asset User wants to loan

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: A contract that receives an Aave FlashLoan, emits an event, then 	pays back the loan

methods.constructor: Aave V1 contract addresses may be found here - https://docs.aave.com/developers/v/1.0/deployed-contracts/deployed-contract-instances

initiateFlashLoan(address,uint256).notice: Attempt to retrieve a flashloan for requested amountUses Aave V1 which only requires 1 asset address to be passed
